item.name: 082015_LemonadeGuyTaylorSwift
item.seo-headline: Taylor Swift meets D-backs Lemonade Guy
item.headline: The D-backs' 'Lemonade Guy' got to meet Taylor Swift (or the other way around)

summary.p: Somebody call VH1 because Derrick Moore is having the best week (well, two weeks, really) ever.
On Aug. 7, Moore -- who you might know as the D-backs "Lemonade Guy" -- was voted by fans as the first ever #BestMLBVendor.

body.p: Somebody call VH1 because Derrick Moore is having the best week (well, two weeks, really) ever.
On Aug. 7, Moore -- who you might know as the D-backs' "Lemonade Guy" -- was voted by fans as the first ever #BestMLBVendor.

p.iframe: Your browser does not support iframes.

body.p: Then, just when you thought that things couldn't get any better than being honored as the top professional in his field, Moore got to rub shoulders with the biggest pop star on the planet. Taylor Swift brought her "1989" world tour to Gila River Arena in Glendale, Ariz., where she sought out Moore.
In a post to her Tumblr, Swift identified Moore as "Skittles Guy," because he was such a hit peddling the candy during her "Red" tour a few years ago.
body.blockquote: Speaking of lemonade, did you see #MLBTopVendor Derrick got to meet THE @taylorswift13?! http://t.co/CdGyfqaiPQ pic.twitter.com/LEqjAopnwD- Arizona Diamondbacks (@Dbacks) August 20, 2015
body.div: "For those of you who have fallen in love with 'Skittles Guy' because of the video of a man passionately selling Skittles before my show on the Red Tour, I got to meet him tonight. His name is Derrick and he knows you guys are obsessed with him. He sells lemonade now and comes up with rhymes to sell it and just generally delights people in the crowd. I was really excited to meet someone who puts such personal flare into his job. Tonight's crowd was unreal and I love you guys so much."
body.p: So, Moore's first in his field AND he's been endorsed by Taylor Swift. The dude is, like, one good photo op away from being a legitimate presidential candidate in 2016.

item.name: 072715_TaylorSwiftAstros
item.headline: The 2015 Houston Astros are so good that they forced Taylor Swift to change her tour schedule
item.seo-headline: Taylor Swift concert moved for Astros playoff run
item.alt-headline: Astros move T-Swift concert for potential playoff run

body.p: It wasn't long ago that Sports Illustrated predicted that the Astros would win the 2017 World Series. Last year, their All-Star second baseman Jose Altuve won the AL batting title and the team's super prospect George Springer was promoted to The Show amid a significant amount of what the kids call "hype."

To their credit, the Astros were thinking ahead of even that 2017 schedule. They surprised some folks by making a splash in the offseason, trading for catcher Evan Gattis and third baseman Luis Valbuena while signing infielder Jed Lowrie and relievers Luke Gregerson and Pat Neshek.

When Tayor Swift announced in December that she would play Minute Maid Park on her forthcoming "1989 World Tour," the Astros went on the record noting that the date would be tentative if everything came together this season.
body.blockquote: Note: the date of the Taylor Swift 1989 tour show at #MMP is subject to change if it conflicts with an #Astros postseason home game.- Houston Astros (@astros) December 11, 2014
body.p: Flash forward to July 2015 and the Astros are more than just in the thick of things. At 55-45, they're only a game back of the AL West lead and have a two-game lead in the Wild Card race. Baseball Prospectus pegs their postseason probability at 82.7 percent. Dallas Keuchel started for the AL in the All-Star Game and phenom shortstop Carlos Correa has done nothing but prove he was worth the wait since his highly anticipated debut.

So, it only makes sense that the Astros are getting their ducks in a row for a postseason run. They recently acquired A's pitcher Scott Kazmir and are still poised to be buyers as the non-waiver Trade Deadline approaches.
They're confident enough, in fact, that the team made good on that tweet from December, moving the T-Swift date to accommodate a potential postseason run.
body.blockquote: #Astros announce new Houston date for Taylor Swift's The 1989 World Tour will be Wednesday, September 9 at Minute Maid Park.- Houston Astros (@astros) July 27, 2015
body.p: Basically, the 2015 Astros are so good at baseball that the biggest pop star on the planet had to rearrange her travel itinerary to accommodate their success.

summary.p: It wasn't long ago that Sports Illustrated predicted that the Astros would win the 2017 World Series. Last year, their All-Star second baseman Jose Altuve won the AL batting title and the team's super prospect George Springer was promoted to The Show amid a significant amount of what the kids call "hype."

item.name: 080715_VendorsDay3
item.alt-headline: Vote now: Who will be the champion #MLBTopVendor?
item.headline: UPDATE: The people have voted and MLB's top vendor is Arizona's Derrick 'Lemonade Guy' Moore

body.p: It takes hundreds of players, dozens of coaches, scores of broadcasters and millions of fans to make each and every MLB season special.

But even with all those people doing their best to contribute, there'd still be no dugout ice cream, no peanuts for Anthony Rizzo to bogart and no gluttonous hot dog monstrosities without the hard work of the food and beverage vendors at MLB stadiums.

In an effort to give these folks the recognition they deserve, we asked you to vote for the #TopMLBVendor. We began with eight noble contestants from across the country, each highly skilled in the art of the concession sale, but only one could wear the Top Vendor crown. Over two days, you told us that the cream of the crop were the D-backs' Lemonade Guy and the Pirates' Mustache Man. It was time for the final showdown. Your candidates:

p.iframe: Your browser does not support iframes.

body.p: Derrick Moore has been hawking concessions at various stadiums for more than 30 years. He tries to think of catchy sayings for all the products he sells because he knows it makes him unique and increases sales.
The only thing more electric than that blue drink he's shilling is his now-iconic pitch: "LEMONADE, LEMONADE LIKE GRANDMA MADE!"
Moore thought of his famous line when he first started selling the stuff at Chase Field and it reminded him of the lemonade his grandmother made for him when he was a child.

p.iframe: Your browser does not support iframes.

body.p: If we're talking about the best vendors in Major League Baseball, we must-ache you whether you've heard the good word about Rick Szeflinski, the beloved peanuts guy in PNC Park's Lexus Club seats.
Szeflinski is a Maryland native who came to Pittsburgh because he always wanted to work for the Pirates. For the past few years, he hasn't just been livin' the dream ... he's been doing it in style.

Bucco fans can't miss him because he's the only vendor who dresses up in retro Pirates uniforms and rocks a Rollie Fingers mustache. He can't miss Bucco fans because he's got incredible aim when doling out those bags of peanuts and Cracker Jacks.

In a battle between two eminently worthy vendors, election analysts predicted a tight race down to the wire. Voting kicked off on Friday afternoon, with Lemonade Guy riding strong social media presence (and an impressive set of pipes) to an early lead:
body.blockquote: You got him to the finals, now get him the crown. Vote "Lemonade Guy" as the #TopMLBVendor: http://t.co/dSlnaTyE5M https://t.co/gve4Uv09zM- Arizona Diamondbacks (@Dbacks) August 7, 2015
"Lemonade, lemonade!" Keep voting for Derrick and make him the #TopMLBVendor: http://t.co/Gk3FQsyNxr https://t.co/n30qVceLfa- Arizona Diamondbacks (@Dbacks) August 7, 2015
body.p: But lo, like a cannonball coming across the bow, Pirates play-by-play man Greg Brown delivered a message: The title of Top Vendor would not be won so easily:
body.blockquote: He's in the finals!! Vote now to get Rickie the win! #mustacheguy #PNCParkvendor http://t.co/8vkBd612cp- Greg Brown (@gbrowniepoints) August 7, 2015
body.p: This is a marathon, not a sprint, and as games began on Friday night, the one they call the Mustache Man mounted a comeback.
body.blockquote: Rick's in the finals & needs your help! Voting ends tonight. VOTE: http://t.co/cMvlB9vIE3 #MLBTopVendor #MustacheMan pic.twitter.com/lVbg0U2m5F- Pittsburgh Pirates (@Pirates) August 7, 2015
body.p: With all of Bucs Nation behind him, Mustache Man narrowed the gap, and things were simply too close to call as the midnight deadline loomed. With things getting desperate, both sides brought out the big guns to help get out the vote:
body.blockquote: 17 minutes left to vote #mustacheman Rick Szeflinski top vendor! Let's go @Pirates fans! http://t.co/8CZoG3jnSx- KDKA Morning News (@kdkamorningshow) August 8, 2015
Link to vote for Derrick: Who will be MLB's top vendor? | http://t.co/UH0MadFW4p http://t.co/QIpdwQf9fW- FOX Sports Arizona (@FOXSPORTSAZ) August 8, 2015
body.p: It was a hard-fought race featuring two deserving winners. But as 12:00 neared, one candidate was able to make a late push and separate himself. With almost 40,000 total votes tallied, your winner is:
Congratulations, Derrick, you're MLB's Top Vendor. We'll let you have the final word:

item.name: DAM Media: 344824383 CIN@ARI: 'Lemonade Guy' wins vote, thanks the fans
